intro: Helosciadium ruta, commonly known as lesser cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves with three oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable component of ecologically diverse habitats.
